intro: Heliophila florulenta var. obliqua, commonly known as the slender heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy environments. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a mild, spicy scent. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in aquatic habitats.
